author: sproul
content:
We just came across a discrepancy between Geth and Nethermind in our integration tests. When provided a payload for which the parent is unknown, Nethermind returns SYNCING while Geth returns ACCEPTED. It seems that Nethermind is correct in this instance by my reading of the spec

More info: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/3378

author: m.kalinin
content: I can confirm that EL must return SYNCING in this case, cc <@360491619402776577>

author: mariusvanderwijden
m.kalinin
content: ACCEPTED is only allowed when "ancestors of a payload are known and comprise a well-formed chain."

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Fix: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/25414
Is it important to get it into the goerli release?

author: m.kalinin
content: I don't think it is too important as long as CLs are treating SYNCING/ACCEPTED in exact same way. <@602753420033785856> what's the LH behaviour around these two statuses?

author: m.kalinin
content: Does geth ever responds with ACCEPTED after this fix?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yes, if we don't have the state for the parent block anymore

author: sproul
content: We treat them the same, AFAIK. The only reason we noticed was an equality check in our tests

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We recently changed the jwt time limit right? Is there any doc for that?
